1. Intel ME: Management Engine always running, can't fully disable, debloat with ME Cleaner if paranoid (breaks some features)
2. DDR5-6000 CL30: Sweet spot Ryzen 7000, 1:1 FCLK (3000 MHz), best perf/price, faster diminishing returns
3. Intel Turbo Boost Max 3.0: Identifies 2 best cores, boosts them higher than others, auto-enabled if good silicon

**1.** PC surchauffe solution imm√©diate: 1) Nettoyer ventilateurs (air comprim√©), 2) V√©rifier p√¢te thermique CPU (changer si >2 ans), 3) Augmenter vitesse ventilateurs (BIOS ou MSI Afterburner), 4) Limiter performances (plan √âquilibr√©), 5) V√©rifier circulation air (c√¢bles bloquent?). Temp√©rature normale idle <45¬∞C, charge <85¬∞C

**2.** NiTriTe vs PC Manager Microsoft: PC Manager simple (d√©butants), NiTriTe avanc√© (power users). PC Manager: 5 features, NiTriTe: 15+ pages outils. PC Manager: Microsoft officiel, NiTriTe: communaut√© open-source

**3.** Utilisation Agent IA: Pose question naturelle (ex: 'Mon PC chauffe en jeu', 'Meilleur RAM DDR5 pour gaming'). IA analyse intent, cherche cat√©gories pertinentes, g√©n√®re r√©ponse d√©taill√©e avec sources. Historique conversationnel

**4.** Rapport Batterie Diagnostic: Affiche 8 d√©tails batterie (Nom, Fabricant, Num√©ro S√©rie, Chimie, Capacit√© Design, Capacit√© Pleine Charge, Cycles, Usure%). G√©n√®re battery-report.html via powercfg. N√©cessite PC portable

n

Voici ce que tu dois savoir:

**1.** BSOD codes courants: MEMORY_MANAGEMENT = RAM d√©fectueuse (test MemTest86 8+ heures), PAGE_FAULT_IN_NONPAGED_AREA = driver corrompu (DDU GPU clean install), SYSTEM_SERVICE_EXCEPTION = driver incompatible (v√©rifier Windows Update), IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL = conflit mat√©riel/driver, DPC_WATCHDOG_VIOLATION = SSD driver obsol√®te (update chipset)

**2.** √âcran Bleu BSOD r√©solution: 1) Noter code erreur (ex: SYSTEM_SERVICE_EXCEPTION, IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL), 2) Google '[code erreur] + [composant PC]', 3) Causes fr√©quentes: RAM d√©fectueuse (test MemTest86), Drivers obsol√®tes (GPU, chipset), Overclock instable (reset BIOS defaults), SSD d√©faillant (CrystalDiskInfo SMART). 4) BlueScreenView analyser dump crash

**3.** Common BSOD codes: MEMORY_MANAGEMENT (RAM/XMP), SYSTEM_SERVICE_EXCEPTION (driver), IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL (driver/OC), WHEA_UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR (hardware/OC), DPC_WATCHDOG_VIOLATION (storage driver)

**4.** DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) Proc√©dure: 1) T√©l√©charger latest DDU, 2) Boot Safe Mode (Shift+Restart > Troubleshoot), 3) Lancer DDU, s√©lectionner GPU marque, 'Clean and Restart', 4) Installer nouveau driver normal mode. N√©cessaire si corruption, artifacts graphiques, crashes
